data.title: Back To December
data.meta_description: "Back To December" is the third track from Taylor Swift's third studio album, Speak Now, released on October 25, 2010, through Big Machine Records. The song became the second single from the album on November 15, 2010. It is also the third track from Swift's third re-recorded album, Speak Now...
data.text:
"Back To December" is the third track from Taylor Swift's third studio album, Speak Now, released on October 25, 2010, through Big Machine Records. The song became the second single from the album on November 15, 2010. It is also the third track from Swift's third re-recorded album, Speak Now (Taylor's Version), released on July 7, 2023, through Republic Records.

Background[]

The song's hidden message ("Tay.") confirmed rumors that it is about Taylor Lautner, her ex-boyfriend.

According to Swift, "Back To December" is an apology to a former lover in the form of a song, something that she has never done before.[2][3] She continued, "I've never felt the need to apologize in a song before. But in the last two years I've experienced a lot, [including] a lot of different kinds of learning lessons. And sometimes you learn a lesson too late and at that point you need to apologize because you were careless."[3] Based on the lyrics, critics have speculated that the song is Swift's apology to her ex-boyfriend, The Twilight Saga actor Taylor Lautner.[2][4] Lautner has confirmed these rumors. "Back To December" was first released as a promotional single from Speak Now on October 12, 2010, as an exclusive campaign by the iTunes Store leading up to the album release.[5] On November 15, 2010, the song was then released as the second single from Speak Now.[6]

Commercial performance[]

"Back To December" is one of fourteen songs on the standard edition of Speak Now which has charted within the top forty of the Billboard Hot 100.[7] Upon its release as a promotional single, "Back To December" debuted at number six on the Billboard Hot 100 with sales of approximately 242,000 digital downloads, on October 12, 2010.[8] Following its single release, the song re-entered Billboard Hot 100 at number seventy-four on the week ending November 27, 2010.[9] The song has since reached a position of number twenty-five. It also peaked at number one on Hot Digital Songs, number twelve on Hot Country Songs, and at number nineteen on Billboard Pop Songs.[10]

Internationally, "Back To December" has had moderate success. In Canada, the song entered the Canadian Hot 100 and peaked at number seven on the week ending October 30, 2010.[11] In Australia, the song entered the Australian Singles Chart at number twenty-six on the week ending October 31, 2010.[12] On the week ending October 18, 2010, the song debuted at number twenty-four on the New Zealand Singles Chart.[13]

Awards and nominations[]

“Back To December” received three awards from four nominations.

Year Organization Award Result 2011 American Country Awards Female Video of the Year Nominated BMI Country Awards Publisher of the Year Won Award Winning Songs Won Teen Choice Awards Choice Breakup Song Won

Live performances[]

Swift first performed "Back To December" in Paris at a showcase at the Salle Wagram theater, on October 18, 2010, to promote her upcoming album, Speak Now, set for release on the October 25, 2010.[16] Swift also performed the song on Speak Now: Taylor Swift Live From New York City, a special program which was streamed live on CMT.com, MTV.com, VH1.com and other MTV Networks websites in Europe, Asia, Australia and Latin America to celebrate the release of her new album.[17]

Swift also performed "Back To December" on several other occasions. On November 10, 2010, she performed the song live at the 44th annual Country Music Association Awards at Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tennessee.[18] Her performance of the song during that event was graded as a "B+" in the Los Angeles Times, noting she "kept it simple" and "rose to the occasion".[19] On November 21, 2010, Swift performed "Back To December" with OneRepublic's "Apologize" as a medley at the 38th American Music Awards.[20][21] Her rendition in that event was graded as a "B-" in the Los Angeles Times, noting that "a brief end-song breakaway into OneRepublic's "Apologize" seemed unnecessary".[22]

Swift performed "Back To December" and several songs from Speak Now on November 24, 2010, during Thanksgiving night, on NBC.[23] She later performed the song on The Ellen DeGeneres Show on December 2, 2010.[24]
